thread.title: Two TSA officers at Lambert lauded for kindness
thread.title_full: Two TSA officers at Lambert lauded for kindness

author: Joe Holleman St. Louis Post-Dispatch
title: Two TSA officers at Lambert lauded for kindness
text:
Get your daily dose of local news right here. Close 
Jarrett Lloyd and Constance Zimmer Two TSA officers at Lambert lauded for kindness ( … ) 
Jarrett Lloyd and Constance Zimmer 
Two security officers at St. Louis Lambert International Airport — Jarrett Lloyd and Constance Zimmer — were honored Tuesday with "Ambassadors of the Year" awards. 
The two received their honors at an employee recognition ceremony, with airport director Rhonda Hamm-Niebruegge handing out the hardware. 
The officers were nominated by Zenobia Perry , the mother of an autistic 24-year-old. Perry said the officers were kind and sensitive while helping her son, who has difficulty speaking, handle the stress related to airport security and traveling during the Christmas holiday. 
"I can’t begin to tell you how positive of an experience this was for us," Perry said. "The kind way that you greet and help us, makes a huge difference." 
Jarrett Lloyd and Constance Zimmer Tags
